Algorithms Functions

Const apply

  • apply(serie: Serie<IArray>, fn: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • Apply a function to a serie. The function signature is fn(item: number|number[], index: number, serie: Serie)

    note

    Operations are done using the items

    example
    const s1 = createSerie( {data: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]} ) // itemSize=1
const s2 = apply(s1, item => item**2 )

// s1.array: [1, 2, 3,  4,  5,  6]
// s2.array: [1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36]
    example
    const s1 = createSerie( {data: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]}, itemSize: 3 )
const s2 = apply(s1, item => item.map( v => v**2) )

// s1.array: [1, 2, 3,  4,  5,  6]
// s2.array: [1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36]

    Parameters

    • serie: Serie<IArray>
    • fn: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const filter

  • filter(s: Serie<IArray>, callback: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • filter a Serie using a callback function.

    note

    Operations are done using the items

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const forEach

  • forEach(series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[], callback: Function): void
  • note

    Operations are done using the items

    example
    const s1 = createSerie( {data: createArray(12, i => i+1), itemSize: 3} )
s1.forEach( i1 => console.log(i1) )
forEach(s1, i1 => console.log(i1) )

const s2 = createSerie( {data: createArray(12, i => i+2), itemSize: 3} )
forEach([s1,s2], ([i1, i2]) => console.log(i1, i2) )

    Parameters

    • series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[]
    • callback: Function

    Returns void

Const map

  • map(series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[], cb: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • map a Serie onto another one using a map function.

    note

    Operations are done using the items

    example
    const s1 = createSerie( {data: createArray(12, i => i+1), itemSize: 3} )
s1.map( i1 => i1.map(i => i**2 ) )
map(s1, i1 => i1.map(i => i**2 ) )

const s2 = createSerie( {data: createArray(12, i => i+2), itemSize: 3} )
console.log( map([s1, s2], ([i1, i2]) => vector(i1).dot( vector(i2) ) )

    Parameters

    • series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[]
    • cb: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const reduce

  • reduce(series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[], callback: Function): Serie<IArray>
  • example
    const A = df.get('A')
const y = df.get('y')
const reduced = reduce([A,y], ([m,x]) => {
    let vec = vector(x)
    let mat = smatrix(m, 3, 3) // sym matrix rank 2
    return mat.transpose().multVec( vector(vec).normalize() ).array
})

    Parameters

    • series: Serie<IArray> | Serie<IArray>[]
    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

    a new Serie

  • Parameters

    • a: Serie<IArray>
    • fn: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

  • Parameters

    • a: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Creation Functions

createArray

  • createArray(length: number, init?: Function | number): any[]

  • Create an Array of a given length and with an initial value set for all entries

    example
    const array1 = create(100, i => i**2)
const array2 = create(100, 0)
const array3 = create(100)

    Parameters

    • length: number

      The length of the array

    • Optional init: Function | number

      A function that has to be called for initialization, a number, or nothing

    Returns any[]

createEmptySerie

  • createEmptySerie(__namedParameters: { Type?: any; count: number; itemSize?: number; shared?: boolean; userData?: {} }): Serie

  • Create a serie from scratch given a type (Array or TypedArray) and a rowsCount. Passed parameters are:

    {
     Type, // Can be either an Array or a TypedArray.
     count, // The number of elements in the array
     itemSize, // The size of each items (length of the array will be rowsCount*itemSize)
     shared // If the TypedArray should be a SharedArrayBuffer or an ArrayBuffer
}

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { Type?: any; count: number; itemSize?: number; shared?: boolean; userData?: {} }
      • Optional Type?: any
      • count: number
      • Optional itemSize?: number
      • Optional shared?: boolean
      • Optional userData?: {}
        • [key: string]: any

    Returns Serie

    The newly created Serie

createFrom

  • createFrom<T>(__namedParameters: { array: T; count: number; itemSize: number }): IArray

  • Type parameters

    • T: IArray

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { array: T; count: number; itemSize: number }
      • array: T
      • count: number
      • itemSize: number

    Returns IArray

createTyped

  • createTyped<T>(Type: any, array: number | number[], shared: boolean): T

  • Create a TypedArray of a given length (number of entries) that can be shared or not. The length is either provided directly, or by an array that will be used to initialize the type array.

    example
    const sharedArray = createTyped(Float32Array, 100, true)
const array       = createTyped(Float32Array, [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9], false)

    Type parameters

    • T

    Parameters

    • Type: any

      The type of the array:

      • Int8Array
      • Uint8Array
      • Uint8ClampedArray
      • Int16Array
      • Uint16Array
      • Int32Array
      • Uint32Array
      • Float32Array
      • Float64Array
      • BigInt64Array
      • BigUint64Array
    • array: number | number[]
    • shared: boolean

      If the Typed has SharedArrayBuffer or not

    Returns T

DataFrame Functions

Const append

  • append(__namedParameters: DataFrame, news: {}): DataFrame

  • Merge series in a dataframe and return a new dataframe

    example
    const df1 = DataFrame.create(...)
const df2 = append(df1, {
  a: createSerie(...),
  b: createSerie(...)
})

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: DataFrame
    • news: {}
      • [key: string]: Serie

    Returns DataFrame

Const merge

  • merge(dfs: DataFrame[], index?: string): DataFrame

  • Merge two dataframe into one

    example
    const df1 = DataFrame.create(...)
const df2 = DataFrame.create(...)
const df3 = DataFrame.create(...)
const df = merge( [df1, df2, df3] )

    Parameters

    • dfs: DataFrame[]
    • Optional index: string

    Returns DataFrame

Utils Functions

Const copy

  • copy(array: IArray | Serie<IArray>, serie: Serie<IArray>): Serie<IArray>

  • Parameters

    • array: IArray | Serie<IArray>
    • serie: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<IArray>

    the same serie

Const duplicate

  • duplicate(serie: Serie<IArray>): Serie<IArray>

  • Return a duplicate of the passed serie (same type, same count, same itemSize and same values)

    Parameters

    • serie: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const exists

  • exists(df: DataFrame, name: string): boolean

  • Check if a TypedArray exist in the DataFrame

    Parameters

    • df: DataFrame
    • name: string

    Returns boolean

Const info

  • info(df: DataFrame | Serie<IArray>): any

  • Parameters

    • df: DataFrame | Serie<IArray>

    Returns any

Const nameOfSerie

  • nameOfSerie(df: DataFrame, s: Serie<IArray>): string | [string, Serie<IArray>]

  • Get the name of a Serie in a [[Dataframe]]. Returns undefined if the serie in not present in the passed [[Dataframe]]

    Parameters

    • df: DataFrame
    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns string | [string, Serie<IArray>]
